intro: Spiloxene declinata, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, blue-green leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has a low-growing habit with a mat-forming structure, and its stems are often covered in a waxy coating. Spiloxene declinata is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects.
